src\\components\\ActionMenu.tsx.description:
You can also use `Actions` instead.
The Action Menu on the top right of a page. You can place Actions here which are in context of the current page.

hideToggleAction.description: Hides the toggle button in mobile view. Can be useful when using multiple ActionMenus and not show the toggle button for each menu.

toggleIcon.description: Icon component for the toggle icon.

useDeprecated.description: Set `true` to use the old ActionMenuItem. Otherwise this component is just an alias to MenuItem.

children.description: Content that will appear on the menu when it's expanded.

featured.description: Content that will appear when the menu is shrunken.

onToggle.description:
Will fire when the state of `open` will change inside of the component.
**Example:** `onToggle={open => this.setState({ open })}`

src\\components\\Body.tsx.description: Contains the content of the page.

containerClass.description: Class name for the container. More info: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/overview/#containers

hasActions.description: Set `true` if this page uses `<Actions />`, so this component will get enough padding to avoid overlapping of the content.

mirrored.description: By default the caret points to the right when closed. Set mirrored and it will point to the left.

src\\components\\DocumentView.tsx.description: Tries to display content in an iframe. When the content can't displayed in an iframe, it will show a download button instead.

content.description: Instead of a source, you can also set the content directly (HTML)

showDocumentLabel.description: Label for the button to display

src\\components\\FluentBtn.tsx.description: Shortcut for ``. Button with a fancy and fluent acrylic effect.

children.description: Content of the button. You can also set all other props you would give a button or a link.

href.description: If set, it will be an `<a>` element. Otherwise it will be a `<button>`.

light.description: Can be set for buttons with white background. The glow will be a little bit darker than.

src\\components\\Grid.tsx.description:
The main component. As soon this component is mounted, it is globally available under `window.blueGridRef`.
Also you can append your own event listeners with `blueGridRef.addEventListener(eventName, (prevProps, prevState) => { })`.

Allowed event listeners:

* **componentDidUpdate** - Component was updated.  
  Example: `blueGridRef.addEventListener("componentDidUpdate", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`
* **pageDidShowAgain** - Page appeared again with the same old state. In the callback function you can reinitialize things.  
  Example: `blueGridRef.addEventListener("pageDidShowAgain", "home", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`
* **pageDidHide** - This page disappeared and another page appears instead.  
  Example: `blueGridRef.addEventListener("pageDidHide", "home", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`

expandSidebar.description: Sidebar is automatically expanded on wider views.

pages.description: Registers pages for the built-in routing system. Example: `[{name: "home", component: <HomePage />}]`

unrouteable.description: When `true`, always the "home" route will be rendered.

disableTitleSet.description: By default, the document title will automatically set. Set this prop to `true` to disable this behaviour.

sidebarToggleIconComponent.description: If you don't use blueicon, you can define another icon element for the sidebar toggle button.

tsType.name: signature

statusIcons.description:
Will replace status icons with custom ones. This will also overwrite the `useBlueicons` option.
This can be a SVG component or a normal element component.

disableHeaders.description: Disables the header bars on pages.

src\\components\\HeaderActions.tsx.description: @deprecated This component isn't neccessary anymore. Just use `ActionMenu` directly in `Header`.

src\\components\\HeaderTitle.tsx.description:
The title area at the header bar.
Depending on its content, the document's title will be set aswell (what will be shown in the browser title bar).

logo.description: Can be an image. Will be placed inside of the `src` attribute.

keepAppTitle.description: Disables that the app title will disappear at a specific view width.

sidebar.description: Is the component used on the sidebar?

src\\components\\Intro.tsx.description: Can be used for a sign-in page.

logo.description: Can be an image. Will be placed inside of the `src` attribute.

title.description: Text which will be placed under the logo.

src\\components\\MenuItem.tsx.description: Link, button or custom component for Sidebar, Actions or ActionMenu

to.description: Sets `to` prop, e.g. when you use the `NavLink` component from React Router.

exact.description: Prop for components by React Router.

icon.description: Icon component or a class name.

isHome.description: When using Blue React's routing system: define this link as home page link.

dropdownClassName.description: Extends class name of the dropdown menu.

children.description: Set children to create a nested `MenuItem` as a dropdown.

elementType.description:
By default, MenuItem is a `"button"</button>. If you set a `href`, it's a `"a"`.
If you want to have it another type, you can pass a component reference with this prop (e.g. `Link`).

src\\components\\Outside.tsx.description: Component that fires an event if you click outside of it

title.description: Will be set to the document's `<title>` tag.

src\\components\\Search.tsx.description: A search bar that can be placed to the sidebar or on a page.

body.description: Is component inside of a page?

resetIcon.description: Define custom icon for the reset button.

sidebar.description: Is component inside of the sidebar?

fluent.description: Should menu items have a Fluent effect. Default: `true`

sidebarClass.description: Extends the class name by the sidebar.

sidebarStyle.description: Sets the `style` prop by the sidebar.

menuClass.description: Extends the class name by the menu.

menuStyle.description: Sets the `style` prop by the menu.

topContent.description: Content on top of the menu.

bottomContent.description: Content for the bottom part of the sidebar.

sliderLabel.description: Sets label inside of the switch. If you set this, you should also set the className "lg" to make the switch larger.

elementType.description: You can change the type of the wrapper element. If you do, the `onChange` event might not be triggered.
